item.title: Pokemon’s Leaked Legends: Galar Starters Are Already Clear
item.description:
The release of Pokemon Legends: Z-A marks the second entry in the "Legends" subseries of the franchise, and puts a new spin on the action-RPG gameplay pioneered by Pokemon Legends: Arceus . The popularity of Pokemon Legends: Arceus and now Pokemon Legends: Z-A makes a third entry feel inevitable, and some of the details of this title already seem set in stone. Alongside the likelihood of a Galar Region setting, there are already three obvious choices for the starters of the next Pokemon Legends game.

Predicting the starters for a Pokemon Legends game is more difficult than it seems, after Pokémon Legends: Z-A 's starters broke the established trend with two Gen 2 critters, Chikorita and Totodile. However, in doing so, Pokemon Legends: Z-A makes the starters for the next game a no-brainer to bring the series full circle. With Galar as the most likely stop for the next Pokemon Legends game, the available starters seem primed to follow in Legends: Z-A 's footsteps.

All Signs Point to the Next Pokemon Legends Game Heading to Galar

Pokemon Legends: Z-A makes plenty of references to the Galar Region, which is geographically close to Kalos, given the two regions' UK and France inspirations, respectively. Players can obtain a few different Galarian regional variants in Pokemon Legends: Z-A , and several NPCs mention the culture of Galar in their dialogue. With these hints sprinkled throughout Legends: Z-A , it seems like Galar is set to receive some more attention after first debuting in Gen 8's Pokemon Sword and Shield .

Pokemon Legends: Galar Was Recently Leaked

As part of the recent TeraLeak 2.0 that revealed Pokemon Gen 10, plans for a Pokemon Legends 3 game were detailed as well. This leak confirms the theory that the Galar Region will be the setting for Legends: Z-A's follow-up, taking place over 1,000 years in the past and diving into the origins of the first Gigantamax Poke Ball. The starters for these games may look very different, given that Legends: Arceus introduced new Regional Forms and Legends: Z-A gave its starters Mega Evolutions, but they still have the chance to fill in a gap created by the previous two Legends games.

The Pokemon Legends Series is Missing Three Obvious Starters

  • Snivy
  • Litten
  • Popplio

Of all the unused starters a Pokemon Legends: Galar game could include, Snivy, Litten, and Popplio are the most likely candidates. So far, the Pokemon Legends series has included all three Gen 2 starters, two of three Gen 5 starters, and only one of three Gen 7 starters:

  • Pokemon Legends: Arceus
    • Rowlet (Gen 7)
    • Cyndaquil (Gen 2)
    • Oshawott (Gen 5)

  • Pokemon Legends: Z-A
    • Chikorita (Gen 2)
    • Tepig (Gen 5)
    • Totodile (Gen 2)

To bring the Legends subseries full circle, Snivy would make the most sense as the Grass-type starter, since it is the lone remaining Gen 5 starter to not yet be featured. With Pokemon Legends: Z-A 's starters completing the Gen 2 trio, Litten and Popplio are the obvious choices for a Fire-type starter and a Water-type starter, respectively, since they would join Legends: Arceus ' Rowlet to complete the Gen 7 starter trio.

As Pokemon Legends: Z-A has established, it's possible for two starters of the same generation to appear as starters for a Legends game. So, Litten and Popplio are both on the table for a Pokemon Legends: Galar game.

The leaked details of this Pokemon Legends: Galar game suggest that Gigantamaxing will be the focus of the game's story. As such, these starters will likely get new Gigantamax Forms, much like the Regional Variants and Mega Evolutions the previous games' starters received. None of these starters have received Gigantamax forms in the past, which makes them more likely starter options than mons like Venusaur, Charizard, and Blastoise, who have already been given G-Max Forms.

62
4.9 /10

Pokemon Legends: Z-A

item.title: Fortnite Leak Reveals Upcoming South Park Collab
item.description:
As players continue to enjoy the variety of new additions to Fortnite during the Fortnitemares Halloween event, new rumors are teasing more potential pop culture collaborations, with South Park allegedly set to make its debut in the beloved game "very soon." Fortnite has already unveiled a number of new crossovers for the spooky season, including the likes of Scooby-Doo , Scream , and Poppy Playtime , and it would seem another major franchise is readying to join the fight.

Since its pilot episode first aired in 1997, South Park has become one of the most popular adult animated television shows, best-known for its no-holds-barred irreverent humor featuring topical riffs on Hollywood, politics, and religion, among many other subjects. Despite a slew of major controversies over the years, the show remains a pillar of online culture, and it should come as no surprise that South Park may be teaming up with fellow media juggernaut Fortnite .

Fortnite South Park Collaboration Leak

Popular Fortnite community member SamLeakss has claimed that "a reliable source at Paramount," the network that owns and broadcasts South Park , teased that the animated series is set to reveal a major crossover with Fortnite "very soon." Fortnite has previously teamed up with other adult television shows like Family Guy , and with the introduction of characters from R-rated movies in Fortnite during Fortnitemares 2025, it serves to reason that the unfiltered cartoon could have a chance at joining the battle royale. The alleged leak did not specify which characters from the show might be making their way into the game, but many are hoping to see the four central boys, Stan, Kyle, Kenny, and Cartman, along with cosmetics that make references to the show.

The South Park rumor comes hot off the heals of an alleged Simpsons Fortnite crossover leak, which teased potential character skins, weapons, and NCPs from that iconic show possibly coming to the game. Fans are now hoping to see both the legendary Simpsons family and hilarious kids from South Park jumping into the fray in Fortnite . Still, even as the rumors and leaks have come from sources that have proven correct in the past, players should always await an official announcement from Epic Games before getting too excited or expecting to see any of these franchises in the hit battle royale.

Audiences may be familiar with previous South Park video game appearances, including the well-reviewed RPG, South Park: The Stick of Truth . While more recent standalone game releases for the series have failed to live up to expectations, a collaboration with Epic Games could be just what South Park and Fortnite fans have been waiting for.

301
8.9 /10

item.title: Microsoft Executive Reaffirms Xbox's Commitment To Switch 2 Support
item.description:
A senior Microsoft official reiterated the company's commitment to bringing Xbox games to the Nintendo Switch 2. The move underscores the gaming giant's ongoing multi-platform publishing pivot that has already resulted in several former Xbox console exclusives launching on the original Switch.

Faced with declining console sales and lengthening game development cycles, Microsoft started boosting its gaming revenues by bringing titles to rival platforms in early 2024. In the latest example of this trend, the Halo 1 remake was just announced for the PS5, which will get it on the same (yet-to-be-announced) day the Xbox Series X/S and PC do in 2026.

Switch 2 Isn't Getting Halo (Yet), But More Xbox Games Are Coming

While the Switch 2 wasn't mentioned in the October 24 announcement, Nintendo's hybrid console will see plenty of support from Xbox. That's according to Microsoft Gaming CEO Phil Spencer, who said as much in a recent interview with Famitsu, conducted before Halo 's multi-platform push was confirmed. "We're trying to lower the barrier to entry for people to play our games," the executive said, pointing to services and initiatives such as Xbox Game Pass and Xbox Play Anywhere, respectively. At the same time, he confirmed that Microsoft plans to keep releasing games for both the Switch 2 and PS5.

Spencer complimented Nintendo for the "great support" provided to Xbox studios during this ongoing multi-platform shift, and offered similar praise for PlayStation. His comments reinforce an earlier commitment to support the Switch 2 with Xbox games, which also saw the executive praise Nintendo as a "great partner" for Microsoft's gaming division.

While Halo isn't yet making the jump to Nintendo's ecosystem, another big Microsoft franchise is, with the newly announced Anniversary Edition of Fallout 4 being confirmed for the Switch 2. The re-release is presently targeting a 2026 launch and will mark the first mainline Fallout game to launch on a Nintendo system. It is not the first overall, as that title is held by Fallout Shelter , which was ported to the Switch in June 2018, three years before Microsoft bought the post-apocalyptic IP as part of its ZeniMax Media acquisition.

All Xbox Games Released on or Confirmed for Nintendo Switch Consoles

Xbox Game Studios also published Ori and the Will of the Wisps, but that game's Switch port was published by Iam8bit, so it is not included above. Games from Microsoft subsidiaries that weren't Microsoft subsidiaries at the time they were released on the Switch (Skyrim, Doom, etc.) were also omitted.

While Microsoft only pivoted to full-fledged third-party publishing in early 2024, the company has been sporadically publishing on Nintendo consoles throughout the Switch 1's life cycle. Most recently, Heretic + Hexen and Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3+4 launched for the Switch in summer 2025. Fallout 4: Anniversary Edition is the first Microsoft game confirmed for the Switch 2 but not the original Switch.

item.title: Upcoming Game Like Baldur’s Gate 3 Gets Exciting Update
item.description:
Upcoming CRPG Solasta 2 has received an exciting update, after developer Tactical Adventures confirmed the game is set to enter Early Access in early 2026. Early impressions have seen Solasta 2 compared to Larian's Baldur's Gate 3 , which would be high praise if it can live up to the potential.

The original Solasta: Crown of the Magister launched back in 2021, and became something of a cult success. Popular among hardcore CRPG fans, but perhaps less so with the wider gaming audience. Still, its "Very Positive" Steam reviews indicate that developer Tactical Adventures got it right the first time around, which is why Baldur's Gate 3 fans are hyped for Solasta 2 . It's a tough comparison, sure, but it's impossible to ignore the visual and gameplay similarities between the two.

Solasta 2 Enters Early Access in Early 2026

In a new gameplay trailer, Tactical Adventures confirmed that Solasta 2 will enter Early Access on Steam in early 2026, but was unable to commit to a more concrete date than that, stating that "we're taking a few more weeks (months?) to polish everything - we want to make sure we give you the game in a state we can be proud of." Solasta 2 will aim to join the list of games that made great use of Early Access, which is a unique challenge for any any RPG.

Watching the new Solasta 2 trailer, it's clear that comparisons to Baldur's Gate 3 aren't merely superficial. Yes, it's easy to point and see obvious comparisons, but Solasta 2 also looks to have the quality to back it up. Its Steam page boasts it will allow players to "bathe in the familiarity of your Tabletop experience," and if it can deliver that, then there's no reason why Solasta 2 can't be an enormous hit.

Those who can't wait until 2026 to get their first taste of Solasta 2 don't have to. It currently has a free demo on Steam, although this is only a very small slice of what will be available to gamers upon the Early Access release. With Larian now busy developing its next titles, there's a gap in the market for a CRPG to tide genre fans over. Solasta 2 could be arriving at just the right time.

Solasta II

item.title: Final Fantasy 7 Director Weighs In On the 'Original vs Remake' Debate
item.description:
Final Fantasy 7 Remake may offer a more engaging first-time experience for newcomers compared to the original PlayStation version, according to game director Naoki Hamaguchi. Although the director of the Final Fantasy 7 Remake saga stated the original game is still worth playing, the updated graphics and presentation style of the ongoing FF7 Remake trilogy would leave a stronger first impression.

It's no secret that Final Fantasy 7 is one of the most iconic JRPGs of the PlayStation era, and helped popularize the genre in the West. Between its memorable ensemble cast, unforgettable story moments, and musical pieces like 'One-Winged Angel' becoming synonymous with the franchise, Final Fantasy 7 carved its name into popular culture. In 2020, after years of teasers from Square Enix, Final Fantasy 7 Remake launched on the PS4 as a timed exclusive. Since then, FF7 Remake and its sequel, Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth , have made their way onto various gaming platforms, with a climactic third chapter now in development.

Final Fantasy 7 Remake Offers A Better First Impression For Newcomers

While both the original Final Fantasy 7 and Final Fantasy 7 Remake are available on multiple platforms, game director Hamaguchi said that the latter version may be preferable for newcomers to try out first. Hamaguchi stated that, while both the original Final Fantasy 7 and FF7 Remake have their merits with fans, he said, "If you have the opportunity, I'd like you to play the Remake first and enjoy it as a fresh experience on its own." Hamaguchi stated that the updated graphics and presentation style of Final Fantasy 7 Remake could leave a stronger first impression on newcomers, despite the game also being designed for fans of the original game.

Hamaguchi also reiterated that, with Final Fantasy 7 Remake Intergrade launching on Switch 2 and Xbox on January 22, the same treatments will be given to Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth and the saga's unnamed third chapter. FF7 Remake Intergrade 's upcoming Switch 2 and Xbox ports will include Streamlined Progression, which will offer players ways to breeze through the game's main story with various toggles, such as a full limit break gauge, double experience points, and maximum materia levels.

However, fans of the original Final Fantasy 7 who want to obtain a physical copy will soon have an opportunity to add to their collections. Square Enix will release physical Switch copies of Final Fantasy 7 as part of a $40 twin-pack with Final Fantasy 8 Remastered on December 9.

9.3 /10
